nl.strohalm.cyclos.dao.accounts.transactions
Interface TransferDAO

All Superinterfaces:
BaseDAO<Transfer>, InsertableDAO<Transfer>, UpdatableDAO<Transfer>
All Known Implementing Classes:
TransferDAOImpl
public interface TransferDAO
extends BaseDAO<Transfer>, InsertableDAO<Transfer>, UpdatableDAO<Transfer>

Data access object interface for transfers

Method Detail

balanceDiff

java.math.BigDecimal balanceDiff(Account account,
                                 Period period)
Sums the balance diff within the given period (optionally null, summing all transfers)

balanceDiff

java.math.BigDecimal balanceDiff(Account account,
                                 Period period,
                                 Transfer transfer)
sums the balance diff for the given account at the moment of the processing of the specified transfer. You can specify if the transfer itself is included or not.

Parameters:
account -
period - this period is used to specify the start date of the difference period. This is usually the official date/time of the last ClosedAccountBalance. The begin date of the period is inclusive, and the endDate of the period will be ignored, as the transfer parameter will be used to specify the end date.
However, you can decide to include or exclude the transfer itself into the balance, by setting the period's inclusiveEnd flag. This flag is false by default, meaning that the balance diff is up to the moment when the specified transfer is about to be processed. If the flag is true, the balance is included in the balanceDiff.
transfer - the transfer itself is not included in the balance diff
Returns:

getChargebackBalance

java.math.BigDecimal getChargebackBalance(Account account,
                                          Period period)
gets the sum of all chargebacks and their original chargedback transfers. This is of course always zero for the present date, but it will not be zero for a time between the original transfer and its chargeback.

Parameters:
account -
period - null is allowed, though this is quite meaningless, as it will then by definition return zero.
Returns:

getChargebackBalance

java.math.BigDecimal getChargebackBalance(Account account,
                                          Transfer transfer,
                                          boolean inclusive)
gets the sum of all chargebacks and their original chargedback transfers. This is of course always zero for the present date, but it will not be zero for a time between the original transfer and its chargeback.

Parameters:
account -
transfer - the transfer's processDate is used as the (inclusive) date. If the transfer itself is included is determined by the inclusive parameter.
inclusive - a boolean determining if the transfer itself is included in the balance.
Returns:

getGrossProductPerMember

java.util.List<Pair<Member,java.math.BigDecimal>> getGrossProductPerMember(StatisticalDTO dto)
                                                                           throws DaoException
List of sums of incoming transactions amounts per member. Used by Activity: all using GrossProduct. Important NOTE: Beware that this method only gets the members who were actually trading. Members with NO incoming trades are NOT included. If you need those, you need to manually add them to the list.

Returns:
a List of Pair objects where the first element is the member and the second is the gross product of the member (sum of incoming transactions).
Throws:
DaoException

getGrossProductPerMonth

java.util.List<KeyDevelopmentsStatsPerMonthVO> getGrossProductPerMonth(StatisticalDTO dto)
gets the gross product summed over all members in a list, where each element in the list specifies a specific month in the period.

Returns:
a list with KeyDevelopmentsStatsPerMonthVOs, containing for each element the gross products, the year and the month.

getNumberOfTransactionsPerMember

java.util.List<Pair<Member,java.lang.Integer>> getNumberOfTransactionsPerMember(StatisticalDTO dto)
                                                                                throws DaoException
List of numbers of incoming transactions per member. Used by Activity Stats > all which use number of trans, % not trading

Parameters:
dto - parameters that filter the query
Returns:
a List of Pair objects where the first element is the member and the second is the number of transactions
Throws:
DaoException

getNumberOfTransactionsPerMonth

java.util.List<KeyDevelopmentsStatsPerMonthVO> getNumberOfTransactionsPerMonth(StatisticalDTO dto)
gets the number of transactions summed over all members in a list, where each element in the list specifies a specific month in the period.

Returns:
a list with KeyDevelopmentsStatsPerMonthVOs, containing for each element the gross products, the year and the month.

Parameters:
currency - may be null
account - may be null
period - may be null
excludeChargebacks - if true, chargebacks are ignored

getPaymentsPerMember

java.util.List<Pair<Member,java.math.BigDecimal>> getPaymentsPerMember(StatisticalDTO dto)
                                                                       throws DaoException
List of sums of outgoing transaction amounts (payments) per member. Used by Taxes Stats. Important NOTE: Beware that this method only gets the members who were actually trading. Members with NO incoming trades are NOT included. If you need those, you need to manually add them to the list.

Parameters:
dto - parameters that filter the query
Returns:
a List of Pair objects where the first element is the member and the second is the sum of payments done by this member
Throws:
DaoException

getSumOfTransactionsRest

java.math.BigDecimal getSumOfTransactionsRest(TransferQuery query)
Calculates the sum of transactions there was on this SystemAccountType for any payments NOT belonging to the set of paymentFilters, during the period

getTransactionAmounts

java.util.List<java.lang.Number> getTransactionAmounts(StatisticalDTO dto)
gets a list with transaction amounts and their id's. There is no separate query for the number of transactions; just use this one and the size of the resulting list is the number of transactions. This is more efficient than a separate query.

getTransactionedAmountToday

java.math.BigDecimal getTransactionedAmountToday(Account account,
                                                 TransferType transferType)
Returns the total amount of transfers today from the given account, with the given transfer type. Only payments in the following status are considered: Payment.Status#PROCESSED, Payment.Status#PENDING and Payment.Status#SCHEDULED.

getTransactionedAmountToday

java.math.BigDecimal getTransactionedAmountToday(Operator operator,
                                                 Account account,
                                                 TransferType transferType)
Returns the total amount of transfers today from the given account, with the given transfer type, performed by the given operator. Only payments in the following status are considered: Payment.Status#PROCESSED, Payment.Status#PENDING and Payment.Status#SCHEDULED.

getTransfers

java.util.List<Transfer> getTransfers(Currency currency,
                                      Account account,
                                      Period period,
                                      Transfer sinceTransfer,
                                      boolean includeChargebacks,
                                      java.lang.Integer maxResults)
gets a List of Transfers, depending on the parameters. Each parameter may be null, in which case it is ignored. Transfers which have not been processed (so with processDate is null) are always excluded.

Parameters:
currency - if there is only one currency, it is advised to pass null here, as this makes the query more efficient.
account -
period - the period over which the transfers are requested. Remember to set Period.setUseTime(true) in case you want the period's begin and end date not rounded to whole days. If having set Period.setUseTime(true), then the begin date is INCLUSIVE, and the end date is EXCLUSIVE, unless otherwise speficied at the period.
sinceTransfer - Any transfer processed after this transfer will be included. The method first checks the processDate of the parameter transfer: any transfer with a newer processDate is returned, and transfers with a processDate equal to sinceTransfer's processDate are only included if their id is greater than the sinceTransfer 's id. This gives a reasonable chance that the method gets all transfers which were processed after sinceTransfer; note however that this is NO guarantee. For example, an authorized payment which was processed 0.1 seconds after sinceTransfer will be missed, as their stored dates in mysql are equal, but the authorized payment's id will be much lower.
includeChargebacks -
maxResults - an Integer specifying the number of entities returned. If null it is ignored.
Returns:
a List of Transfers, ordered by processDate and id.

hasTransfers

boolean hasTransfers(Account account)
Returns whether the given account has at least a transfer

search

java.util.List<Transfer> search(TransferQuery query)
                                throws DaoException
Searches for transfers. If no entity can be found, returns an empty list. If any exception is thrown by the underlying implementation, it should be wrapped by a DaoException.

The condition specified by query.getMember() should only be taken in account when query.getOwner() != null and query.getType() != null.

Throws:
DaoException

searchTransfersAwaitingAuthorization

java.util.List<Transfer> searchTransfersAwaitingAuthorization(TransfersAwaitingAuthorizationQuery query)
Searches for transfers awaiting authorization

updateAuthorizationData

Transfer updateAuthorizationData(java.lang.Long id,
                                 Payment.Status status,
                                 AuthorizationLevel nextLevel,
                                 java.util.Calendar processDate,
                                 Rated rates)
Updates the transfer with authorization data

Parameters:
rates - may be null if rates not enabled. Otherwise, must contain an emissionDate and/or an expirationDate. Rates can only be updated if the processDate is not null. The method checks on this.
